original: Izikowitz, Karl Gustav, intendent, Göteborg, f. 26/11/03 i Jönköp. av köpm. Marcus L o. Dina Maliy. — Fil. kand. i Gbg 29, fik lic. 31, fii. dr 35. Docent i allm. o. jämför, etnografi v. Gbgs högsk. 36. E. aman. v. Gbgs mus. etnogr. avd. 29-33, tf. int. där 32, int. sed. 44. Rock e fell ers tip. 36-36, stud. i London, i Berkeley i Caiif. samt v. École fr ang. d’ Extreme Ori-ent i Llanoi, föret. forskn:res. t. Mexiko 36 o. Franska Indokina 36-38. Skr.: Musicai instruments of the South American indians (35), Faste-ning the soul (41), The community house of the Lamet (43), Över dimmornas berg (reseskiidr. 44) m. m.
translated: Izikowitz, Karl Gustav, superintendent, Gothenburg, born on 26/11/03 in Jönköping, son of merchant Marcus L and Dina Maliy. He received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Gothenburg in 1929, obtained his Ph.D. degree in 1935, and became an associate professor of general and comparative ethnography at the University of Gothenburg in 1936. He worked as an assistant curator at the Museum of Ethnography in Gothenburg from 1929 to 1933, acting as its superintendent in 1932, and was then appointed the superintendent in 1944. In addition to studying at the École frangaise d'Extrême-Orient in Hanoi, he conducted research expeditions to Mexico in 1936 and French Indochina from 1936 to 1938. His publications include Musicai instruments of the South American Indians (1935), Fastening the soul (1941), The community house of the Lamet (1943), Over misty mountain tops (1944), among others.

publications.name: Musical Instruments of the South American Indians
The Community House of the Lamet
